t: Matthew 16
The Demand for a Sign
The*p Pharisees and Sadducees came to Jesus and tested him by asking him to show them a sign from heaven.

and*r in*r the*r morning,*r ‘Today*r it*r will*r be*r stormy,*r for*r the*r sky*r is*r red*r and*r overcast.’*r You*r know*r how*r to*r interpret*r the*r appearance*r of*r the*r sky,*r but*r you*r cannot*r interpret*r the*r signs*r of*r the*r times.*r
A*r wicked*r and*r adulterous*r generation*r looks*r for*r a*r sign,*r but*r none*r will*r be*r given*r it*r except*r the*r sign*r of*r Jonah.”*r Jesus then left them and went away.
The Yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees
When*p they went across the lake, the disciples forgot to take bread.
“Be*r careful,”*r Jesus said to them. “Be*r on*r your*r guard*r against*r the*r yeast*r of*r the*r Pharisees*r and*r Sadducees.”*r

Or*r the*r seven*r loaves*r for*r the*r four*r thousand,*r and*r how*r many*r basketfuls*r you*r gathered?*r

Peter Declares That Jesus Is the Messiah
When*p Jesus came to the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who*r do*r people*r say*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is?”*r

From*p that time on Jesus began to explain to his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things at the hands of the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, and that he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life.
Peter*p took him aside and began to rebuke him. “Never, Lord!” he said. “This shall never happen to you!”
